fields.description: Can disable Scrum while in the middle of a sprint and can continue using the boards. Can copy scrum boards ad infinitum to continue using Scrum despite disabling

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When viewing an issue through the Rapid Board issue quick view panel, one notices that the sort order for comments on the quick view panel (newest at top) is not the same as the ordinary sort order on the normal issue view (newest at bottom).

Esentially, we would like to control the sort order of the comments in the quick view panel in GH.
fields.summary: Option to sort comments on issue quick view panel on Rapid Boards in differing orders

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It can be annoying that you have to slowly move your mouse inside the mini-chart in order to select a range of time that includes the edge of the chart (either the right or left edge).

This could be improved so that, when the mouse moves outside of the mini-chart and the mouse is still being held down, we just select the maximum value as the end of the range.
fields.summary: Improve the mini-chart behaviour when trying to select a range that includes the edge of the chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps:
# Have a Scrum Rapid Board
# Have at least 3 issues in the backlog
# Put the first issue into the sprint marker
# Start the sprint
# In Plan Mode, re-rank the two remaining issues (swap them)
# In Work Mode, complete the sprint (issue in sprint is incomplete)

When you go back to Plan Mode, notice that the sprint marker is at the very top of the backlog, as opposed to being below the first issue in the backlog.
fields.summary: Ranking on Plan Mode after starting a sprint affects where the marker is placed when sprint is completed

fields.description:

# Go to a Scrum Rapid Board's Plan Mode

# Reloading the page makes the sprint marker return

fields.description:
Upgrading to a version with Scrum for RB adds a custom field, which is then missing from the index for all pre-existing issues. 
This requires a reindex to address.

To see the problem: start up from default (which imports the sample dataset) and create a scrum RB for PRO. The plan tab will be empty, even though there are loads of issues that should be there.
fields.summary: As a user I want the rapid board to tell me (both at the time of enabling the lab and from the Rapid Board itself) I need to reindex if scrum is not working

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If the locale of the user (or the system) is not in English, the charts on the Rapid Board still render their x-axis labels using English month names.

Apparently, flot has the ability to do this, using a {{monthNames}} parameter to {{$.plot.formateDate}}.
fields.summary: Rapid Board charts do not translate the date values on x-axis into user's locale

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:

# Create a new project
# Create one issue
# Create a new rapid view with Scrum preset
# Go to Plan Mode 
# Ensure that the sprint marker is above the one issue
# Try to "rank" the issue above the sprint marker

You will get an error.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The control chart in the RapidBoard is very useful for interactive investigation of outliers and other cycle time issues. We would really like to be able to get at the underlying detail data for all of the displayed issues so that additional analysis can be applied in Excel.

Ideally this would be an export that included issue information, and then had a column for each displayed workflow state and the count of days in that state (as displayed in the hover over window for an issue in the RB control chart).
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I would like to be able to export the cycle time data in the control chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Rapid Board Administrator - I want to be able to set issue count constraint over multiple columns - So that I can set WIP for more than one column giving my team intensives to focus their efforts and helping to get stuff into production.

Explanation : When implementing Kanban, I would like to give my team intensives to focus their efforts and helping to get stuff into production, to clear the “Done” column and maximize the flow.


Having issue count constraint over more than one coulmn This will allow to "simulate" sub columns as shown in attached picture and described on page 42 here - http://www.infoq.com/minibooks/kanban-scrum-minibook
fields.summary: Issue Count Constraint over more that one Column

fields.description: When using the rapid board, is it possible to show the resolution on the card when they're in the done column? Would make it easier when walking the board during standup

fields.description:
The Swimlane AO entity has a query field that's String (255)
A query can easily grow beyond the limit and so the field should be refactored to use a CLOB instead.

This also causes issues migrating from pre-AO RapidBoards.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to enter a Swimlane query longer than 255 characters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Upgrade task 11 migrates the rapid board labs data from propertySets to the new AO tables. In case there is labs data around that cannot be migrated (like string fields longer than 255 chars), the upgrade task should log an error and skip that particular rapid view. It must not throw an exception.

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3677
fields.summary: migration of labs rapid views should ignore invalid data

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The specific scenario our team is running is that they are using statistics in the planning board to define capacity per team member. 

The team would like to set up a statistic per person (filter), because based on vacation, etc., different people have different capacity (expected aggregated value/ statistic in a number field) on the team per sprint/ iteration. 

At this time because the same, single statistic is applied to the board view, the team has to manually change the statistic per person (filter) to check their capacity using the statistic feature. Ideally, we could set up different statistics per field and associate them with a specific filter.
fields.summary: As a user, I can associate a statistics configuration to a filter in the planning board in order to view a specific statistic in context

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If a user creates subtasks for each of their issues, and does all the time tracking on the subs tasks, the parents will inherit the aggregate data for the time tracking using the time tracking sum fields, but this is not used by GreenHopper.

This means if you want to look at just the parents, hiding the subtasks, you can't do this and have an accurate reflection of the time required for each issue.
fields.summary: Hiding Subtasks means GreenHopper loses their time tracking stats rather than using the sum fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*:
 # JIRA imports the issues from CSV and sets the status to closed.
 # There is no history on the issue showing a status change from Open to Resolved, or something similar
 # GreenHopper scans for status changes in the history, finds none and assume it's still Open, therefore does not mark it as Done
 # Re-opening an issue means GreenHopper sees that re-opening as a +1 to the number of issues that are not done (because it went from Done to Not Done)
 # Closing it again will then mean that GreenHopper simply does a -1 to burn down, but is only taking away the +1 it added on the re-opening

*Workaround*
 Use [Project Import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/restoring-a-project-from-backup-802592982.html] functionality to import the project and issues to JIRA
fields.summary: Issue Burndown Chart incorrect after import issues from CSV

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: Agile > Chart Board/Task Board/ or Planning Board > Select + New Card 

The following error will appear in the atlassian-jira.log:

{code} 2011-12-12 14:55:34,657 http-443-35 ERROR mfinch 895x157490x1 mxcf67 192.168.144.114 /secure/GHAddIssue.jspa [velocity] RHS of #set statement is null. Context will not be modified. templates/greenhopper/jira/issue/fields/ranking-field.vm [line 12, column 1]{code}

When you Agile > Chart Board/Task Board/ or Planning Board > Highlight any card > Select + New Card no error will be thrown in the logs. 

It appears that the cause of this error is that GreenHopper is trying to find the issue that is currently selected and since there are no issues selected this error is thrown.  

*Note that these are red herring errors and have no affect on the performance/functionality of JIRA or GreenHopper.*
fields.summary: Creating new card while on Planning, Task, or Chart Board results in error  - RHS of #set statement is null

we have the following problem when creating/moving tasks.
There is a workflow having different states in "Canban" for the allocation of tickets. Sometimes we experience the strange effect, that tasks having a state somewhere in the middle of the workflow and being moved to the succeding state are placed in the column for the initial state.
Executing a re-indexing , the task can be seen back in the  correct state.

When upgrading to greenhopper 5.8.4, I get the stacktrace below.
I have a custom ranking field present.
What actions should I take?

011-12-14 09:22:45,526 main ERROR      [jira.issue.managers.DefaultCustomFieldManager] Could not load custom field type plugin with key 'com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:greenhopper-ranking'. Is the plugin present and enabled?

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Select a Rapid View
# Configure it
# Click on the Saved Filter to edit it
# Clear out all the text
# Press Enter

The page "submits" and takes you to the Manage Rapid Views screen.

There should be a validation error saying that you must enter a saved filter.

Note that clicking out of the text field, as opposed to pressing Enter, behaves "properly" in that it effectively cancels your edit.
fields.summary: Edit Saved Filter of Rapid Board behaves strangely when text is cleared and Enter is pressed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Rapid Board admin - I want to be able select which vertical column my horizontal swim lanes should span across - So that workflow status can represented in both horizontal and vertical planes on a Rapid Board. 


Comments: The motivation for having this functionality, is a highly configurable Rapid Board (Kanban board), using the most of 'white space' on the board it self. A typical scenario for use Rapid Board is on a big screen or projector in a project area. Having this will allow you to display more of the actual workflow on one screen, regardless of workflow complexity. Attached is a simple visual representation of what I'm looking for.
fields.summary: Configurable column span for horizontal swim lanes

fields.description:
AO creates varchar fields for String properties with a length limit of 255 chars (for whatever obscure reason).

GH has to validate the length of fields (client & server) and return an appropriate error message. Currently we're getting a 500.

In the process of this, we should decide if 255 chars is making sense for us or if we rather use the larger text type.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It seems that the selected issue after doing these operations is inconsistent.

If you Send To Top the bottom issue in a column, and there are no other columns beneath that column (i.e. other swimlanes), that issue stays selected as it moves to the top.

If the issue is the bottom of the column, and there are other swimlanes below that column, the selected issue becomes the issue at the top of the next swimlane.

If the issue is not at the bottom, and you send it to top, the issue in the position one below where that issue was is selected.

If you are sending issues to the bottom, then the issue that moves into the position where your issue was becomes selected.

We need to revisit this and ensure the correct logic is being applied in all cases.
fields.summary: Send To Top and Send To Bottom shortcuts select wrong issue after ranking on Rapid Board
